content: is this cowl cozy yes chunky sure is cabled you know it and does it also come in a scarf version too omg stop it well if that sounds like the sort of project you like then look no further we ve written this freebie up in two different thick yarn weights 14ply/chunky for that modest touch of something chunky as well as 20ply/super bulky for if you love that oversized look of big squishy goodness whichever you choose they are both easy peasy quick to finish and a great option if it s your first time knitting cables so what are you waiting for grab some big needles and let s cast on **materials** **14ply / chunky version** **dimensions ** approximately 20cm wide x 140cm long cowl or 180cm long scarf **yarn ** any 14ply / bulky weight yarn we used 5 balls of chaska muhu chunky 100% alpaca 50m/50g in colour n21 but due to the drape of this yarn we would recommend 4 balls if you d like your cowl to sit more snug against your neck **quantity ** 200-250m cowl or 300m scarf **needle ** 7 00mm needle **gauge ** 12 5sts to 10cm in garter stitch **materials ** yarn needle for sewing up 4 stitch markers **20ply / super bulky version** **dimensions ** approximately 28cm wide x 150cm long cowl or 200cm long scarf **yarn ** any 20ply / super bulky yarn we used super woolly from woolly yarn co 100m/200g in colour ginja ninja we used 3 skeins for our scarf but if you really like to wrap yourself up we d suggest adding a 4th skein **quantity ** 200m cowl or 300-400m scarf **needle ** 12 00mm needle **gauge ** 8sts to 10cm in garter stitch **materials ** yarn needle for sewing up 4 large stitch markers this pattern was designed with the help of my friend shannon crawford - thanks shan
